{{Wired embedded system |brand=DrayTek |model=Vigor 2200USB |revision= |upc= |ean=4719853551329 |asin= |price= |est_release_date=04/2001 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=Yes |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Samsung |cpu1_model=S3C4510B;ARM, SAMSUNG 206B, S3C4510B01-QER0; |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu1_cores= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |cpu2_cores= |fla1=2 MiB |fla1_brand=Intel |fla1_model=TE28F160C3BA90 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=4 MiB |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W981616AH-8 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 1.1 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Kendin |sw_model=KS8995;KENDIN, KS8995, 0204A3, DC5197.0K2, 1262056; |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=USB 2.0 controller (host/device), full-speed (12Mbps);Philips;ISP1161;ISP1161, A8430, TPr01, S0B;1; |flags=power switch |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui_eth=00:50:7F }} {{TagLine|Vigor2200USB DSL Router}}
[ftp://ftp.draytek.com/Vigor2200USB/ ''Vigor2200USB'' folder on '''DrayTek''''s public FTP server] This device is supposed to use a USB ADSL modem (not included) for its WAN connection. "V2200USB Router" and "P/N:401-1201200" is silkscreened on the top of one 2200USB's board. :A date code of '''0204''' is etched onto the bottom of the board. ==Additional external links== ===Reviews=== *[http://www.thinkbroadband.com/hardware/reviews/60-draytek-vigor2200usb.html On '''ThinkBroadband'''] *[http://www.practicallynetworked.com/review.asp?pid=427 On '''Practically Networked'''] (dated 2002-01-24) ==Included power supply(/ies)== The power supply included with the device looks to be a '''FSP Group''' FSP013-1AD201. {{hasPowerSupply |brand=FSP Group |model=FSP013-1AD201 |revision= |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.5 |input_c=AC |input_conn=C13 |output_v=5 |output_a=2.5 |output_conn=barrel |style=modular, brick }}
